0:
Roll a six-sided die and apply the result.
1: Halve your Life Points. 2: Draw 1 card.
3: Your opponent discards 1 card.
4: Negate the effects of 1 face-up card on the field, until the end of this turn.
5: Destroy 1 card on the field.
6: Destroy 1 card in your hand.
7. Special Summon 1 monster from your hand or from either Graveyard.
00:
Roll a six-sided die and apply the result.
● 1 or 2: Immediately after this effect resolves, you can Normal Summon 1 monster.
● 3 or 4: You can Special Summon 1 monster from your GY.
● 5 or 6: You can Special Summon 1 Level 5 or higher monster from your hand.
7: Draw 3 cards, then you can discard 2 cards.
1: Call the type of card (Spell, Trap, or Monster) on top of your Deck. If you call it right, exchange your current Life Points with your opponent's current Life Points.
2: Your opponent cannot check cards in the GYs. Your opponent calls the name of the first monster found at the bottom of your GY. If that player calls it right, the monster is banished. If that player calls it wrong, the monster is Special Summoned to your side of the field.
3: Add 1 card from your hand to your opponent's hand, then gain 2000 LP.
4: All players must keep their hands revealed this turn. While their hands are revealed by this effect, if any players have cards with the same name in their hands, they cannot activate cards, or the effects of cards, with that name.
5: Each player must turn their respective Decks upside down and proceed with the current Duel. (If the deck is already upside-down, turn it back into it's normal position)
6: The next time an effect is activated that would make you roll a six-sided die (or dice) or flip a coin(s), you can pay 1000 LP to decide the result of 1 die or coin.
7: Call 2 numbers and roll a six-sided die. If you roll a number you called, your LP do not get lower than 1 until the end of your opponent's next turn.
8: Once this turn, you may look at the top 3 cards of your opponent's Deck and rearrange them in any order.
9: Both players reveal their hands and add 1 card from each other's hand to their hand.
10: You can discard any number of cards and declare 1 type of card (Monster, Spell, or Trap). Your opponent sends 1 card of the declared type from their Deck to the GY for each discarded card.
11: If your LP are less than your opponent's, you can take control of 1 Set card in your opponent's Spell & Trap Zone.
12: You can look at your opponent's hand. You may choose to have that player shuffle their hand into their Deck and draw the same number of cards they shuffled into their deck.
13: Toss a coin: ● Heads: Your opponent cannot Normal Summon or Flip Summon until the end of their next turn ● Tails: You cannot Normal Summon or Flip Summon until the End Phase.
14: You may look at the top of both your and your opponent's Deck. If the decks are upside-down, look at the bottom card(s) instead.
15: Until the end of your next turn, whenever a player would take damage, they gain that amount of LP instead.
16: Each player chooses 1 monster they control and switches control of those monsters with each other. Those monsters cannot change their battle positions for the rest of this turn. (If there are multiple players, each player switches to the next clockwise player)
17: Declare 1 Monster Type. All face-up monsters on the field become that Type until the end of your next turn.
18: Declare 1 Monster Attribute. All face-up monsters on the field become that Attribute until the end of your next turn.
19: Both players banish 1 card from their Decks, face-down, and if they do, during the End Phase of this turn, both players add to their hands the card their opponent banished by this effect.
20: Toss a coin: ● Heads: Draw 2 cards. ● Tails: Your opponent draws 2 cards.
21: If your LP are less than your opponent's, you may look at your opponent's Set Spell and Trap Cards this turn.
22: Each Player draws 1 card, then each player discards 1 card.
23: No monster can attack until your next turn.
24: Remove all counters from the field.
25: Your opponent declares a monster Level from 1 to 12. Excavate cards from the top of your Deck until you excavate a monster that can be Normal Summoned/Set, then, if that monster is the same Level as the one declared by your opponent, send all excavated cards to the GY. If not, Special Summon the excavated monster, also send the remaining cards to the GY.
26: Until your next turn, no player can play or Set any Spell or Trap Cards.
27: Switch the ATK and DEF of all face-up Effect Monsters currently on the field.
28: During your Draw Phase, you may search your Deck for any card, reveal it to your opponent, and add it to your hand instead of drawing.You may not activate or summon that card this turn.
29: Target any number of monsters in your GY; Special Summon them, and if you do, you lose 1000 LP for each monster Special Summoned by this effect. You cannot conduct your Battle Phase the turn you activate this card.
30: Declare 1 card name. Cards with that name and their effects cannot be used for the rest of this Duel.  Cards already on the field are not affected even if they leave the field (including face-down cards). (However, other cards sharing the same name with that card are still affected regardless)
31: Offer your opponent a handshake. If they accept your handshake, each player's Life Points become half the combined Life Points of both players. If you have "Unity" in your hand and show it to your opponent, they must accept the handshake.
32: Return all Spell and Trap Cards on the field to the hand.
33: If both players have 15 or more cards in their Graveyards: Both players swaps the cards in their Graveyard with the cards in their Deck, then shuffles their Deck.
34: Destroy all tokens on the field. Increase your LP by the number of tokens x 800.
35: Special Summon a "Roulette Token" (Fairy/Wind/Level ?/ATK ?/DEF ?). That token's level is equal to the number of cards on your side of the field before the token was summoned. That token's ATK and DEF is equal to it's level x 300.
36: You can pay 2000 life points and discard 2 cards from your hand, and if you do: Roll a six-sided die and draw cards equal to the result.
